creator: jjbbss

content:
It's not possible to change account types, manually nor automatically. Also, "Leave messages on server until I delete them" is not the default value, which an account would be if the account type had been automatically changed.

> 1) Can I change back to IMAP from POP without losing more

Not possible to change account types. The only way is to create a new account in Thunderbird for that email address

> 2) Is there a way to restore any of these emails to the server? > 3) How can I prevent this in the future; once I update and restart, it is too late to prevent something like this as the damage is done.

Check trash? Suggest contact Earthlink.
creator: wsmwk

content:
I forgot the mention that I have my Thunderbird account server settings as "Leave messages on server" "Until I delete them".

Could this be temporarily overridden on either a restart or a crash to "cancel" the Leave messages settings?

Thank you
creator: msprinker

content:
It seems likely to me that your data is either in default-release (which is the normal default) or Don (which must have been created by you).

Use your OS to examine those directories and determine, by usage date and contents, which one has your most recent data.

Please post your results.
creator: wsmwk

content:
Wayne Mery said
Do Help > Troubleshoot Mode > About:profiles - tell us what profile is in use, and which other profiles are shown.

Ok. There are four profiles. They are...

Profile: default-release Profile: default Profile: Don Profile: default-release-1

The last one on the list...default-release-1...is the profile currently in use.
creator: doncapps

content: Do Help > Troubleshoot Mode > About:profiles - tell us what profile is in use, and which other profiles are shown.
creator: wsmwk
